feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Thu, 17 Aug 2023 18:01:38
entry.summary:
Tech:
- I built my own app without knowing a single line of code. It was surprising how fast I got everything to work using AI and other tools.
- Salesforce AI Researchers Introduce the Evolution of LLM-Augmented Autonomous Agents and the Innovative BOLAA Strategy
- This Week In React #156: Server Actions, React Falls Behind, Expo Builds, Suspense Throttling, Obsidiosaurus, Expo DevTools...
- Effortless Containerization: Deploying Spring Boot and MySQL with Docker and Docker Compose
- Boost your Git Squash-Rebase Workflow with these Commands! (auto-squash, auto-commit, auto-rebase, auto-push)
- If ChatGPT had a brain, this is what it would look like
- ‘I sold my soul to the devil’: Background actors say they’re already losing work to AI
- How ‘heritage algorithms’ are shaping the future of art and design
- YouTube Ads May Have Led to Online Tracking of Children, Research Says
- An Iowa school district asked ChatGPT if a list of books contains sex scenes, and banned them if it said yes. We put the system to the test and found a bunch of problems.

Business:
- Forget AI - a $100 trillion investment opportunity awaits in clean energy, Schroders says
- Starbucks' $1.25 cold foam is the chain's most popular drinks add-on, and one of its most expensive. This is how it's made.
- Bud Light is winning over Americans again, 4 months after its collaboration with Dylan Mulvaney sparked a conservative boycott
- I started a blog and grew it into a $14 million business. Here's how I did it through affiliate marketing and social media.
- Paramount changed its mind about selling its majority stake in BET Media Group
- A distressed Rudy Giuliani made the hike all the way down to Mar-a-Lago to personally beg Trump to help pay off some of his legal bills: CNN

AI:
- I built my own app without knowing a single line of code. It was surprising how fast I got everything to work using AI and other tools.
- Salesforce AI Researchers Introduce the Evolution of LLM-Augmented Autonomous Agents and the Innovative BOLAA Strategy
- ‘I sold my soul to the devil’: Background actors say they’re already losing work to AI

Other:
- The fight over 'return to office' policies has a dirty downside
- I rented a Tesla on Turo for a road trip. I own an EV, but 3 things about the Model 3 still surprised me.
- Gig workers are tracking customers who reduce tips after delivery by marking their homes on Google Maps
- US startup Joby is building an electric aircraft it wants to use to fly people between airports and cities for the price of an Uber — take a look
- Forget Italy's 1 euro homes. You can buy a crumbling, 2-bedroom fixer-upper for $1 in Michigan.
- Getting a job at Apple without going to college or doing LeetCode
- The future of open source is still very much in flux
- Is The Way Many Cities Have Been Designed Making Them Even Hotter?
- The mystery of the social media disinformation war on plant-based meat
- You have a good excuse to turn off your camera during Zoom meetings—it’s better for the environment
- Of course the posters for the 2024 Paris Olympic Games are high art
- Use of UK plasma for the manufacture of albumins and vCJD risk - GOV.UK
- An Iowa school district asked ChatGPT if a list of books contains sex scenes, and banned them if it said yes. We put the system to the test and found a bunch of problems.

Insights:
- Clean energy presents a significant investment opportunity, potentially worth $100 trillion.
- Starbucks' $1.25 cold foam is a popular and expensive add-on to their drinks.
- Bud Light's collaboration with Dylan Mulvaney helped win back American consumers.
- Building a successful blog through affiliate marketing and social media can lead to a $14 million business.
- Electric vehicles, such as the Tesla Model 3, continue to surprise consumers with their features.
- Gig workers are using Google Maps to track customers who reduce tips after delivery.
- US startup Joby aims to revolutionize air travel with its electric aircraft.
- The future of open source software remains uncertain.
- The design of cities may contribute to increased heat levels.
- Social media disinformation campaigns target plant-based meat.
- Turning off cameras during Zoom meetings can have environmental benefits.
- The use of AI in background acting is impacting job opportunities.
- The Paris Olympic Games posters are considered high art.
- The UK government is assessing the risk of vCJD in albumin manufacture.
- The use of AI systems to ban books based on content raises concerns about accuracy and reliability.
